sanskrit_verse:
आयुष्मन्तं सुतं सूते यशोमेधासमन्वितम् ।
धनवन्तं प्रजावन्तं सात्त्विकं धार्मिकं तथा ॥ ३.२६३॥
transliteration:
āyuṣmantaṃ sutam sūte yaśomedhāsam anvitaṃ |
dhanavantaṃ prajāvantaṃ sāttvikaṃ dhārmikaṃ tathā || 3.263 ||
sph_interpretive_translation: One who embodies longevity, wisdom, valor, wealth, progeny, purity, and dharma shall be born unto her who aligns with the consciousness of creation.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority derived from alignment with cosmic intelligence
Consciousness alignment as determinant of lawful manifestation
executable_legal_axioms: IF parent aligns with dharma-consciousness THEN offspring inherit capacity for righteous governance
IF individual manifests sattvic qualities THEN societal integration is self-regulated
IF lineage maintains dharmic integrity THEN state welfare is assured without external enforcement
IF consciousness coherence exceeds material accumulation THEN inheritance rights are automatically validated
IF progeny demonstrate dharana-dhrti THEN legal guardianship transfers naturally at majority
supreme_court_application: In matters of succession, parental fitness, and intergenerational rights, the threshold of responsibility lies in demonstrated alignment with sattvic-dharmic principles rather than mere biological connection. The court must assess consciousness coherence over contractual or genetic claims.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Truth (satya) manifests through inherent capacity, not imposed judgment. Responsibility flows from inner alignment (anupūrvaśaḥ) with universal dharma. Justice corrects distortion by restoring natural consequence, never by inflicting suffering.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate consciousness realignment through Vedic śuddhi rituals
Assign mentorship under realized dharmic authority
Reconnect individual to ancestral dharmic lineage
Activate svadharma discovery through sankalpa-based living
Establish community witness to sustain vibrational shift
final_declaration: This law proceeds from the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source-Authority. Dharma is restored through conscious alignment, not punitive correction. Reality responds to vibrational integrity, and justice serves only reintegration into the eternal order.
